about.meta.description.message: ZH-HANS-Learn about Shira and the team behind it ‚Äî a project by Horizontal, a non-profit creating security and privacy tools that help individuals and organizations defend against phishing attacks.

about.horizontal.description.message: ZH-HANS-Shira is a project by Horizontal, a technology non-profit that builds security and privacy technology to help people be safer online.

about.horizontal.donationText.message: ZH-HANS-You can help us improve and sustain Shira by

about.horizontal.translationText.message: ZH-HANS-To contribute to the translation of Shira into new languages, email us at

about.why.easy.description.message: ZH-HANS-Shira was created considering communities that are the most at-risk of phishing attacks, especially users with limited tech literacy.

about.why.customizable.description.message: ZH-HANS-We try to make phishing messages look as realistic as possible, to simulate what internet users actually face in their daily lives and the phishing attacks they are likely to face.

about.why.privacy.description.message: ZH-HANS-We do not collect, save, or share any data about users visiting Shira or taking quizzes. To learn more, check out our privacy policy and a recent security audit performed by an independent security firm.

about.how.opensource.message: ZH-HANS-Shira is Open Source, and licencesed under MIT 2.0.

about.how.design.message: ZH-HANS-At Horizontal, we design and develop centering the needs of the community.

about.how.community.message: ZH-HANS-Shira is multilingual, co-created with users and centering security and privacy.

about.how.green.message: ZH-HANS-This website runs on green energy.

about.how.greenAlt.message: ZH-HANS-This website runs on green hosting - verified by thegreenwebfoundation.org

features.meta.description.message: ZH-HANS-Explore Shira's features for educators and security professionals.

features.meta.longDescription.message: ZH-HANS-Explore Shira's features for educators and security professionals ‚Äî create realistic phishing quizzes, simulate real attacks, track team progress, and build lasting phishing awareness.

features.intro.title.message: ZH-HANS-Create {your1} own phishing quizzes for {your2} team to address {your3} threats

features.images.fishAlt.message: ZH-HANS-Illustration of a fish representing phishing

features.allFeatures.title.message: ZH-HANS-All the features you need to keep your team safe

features.allFeatures.description.message: ZH-HANS-Nobody knows your team‚Äôs needs better than you. Shira gives you full control in creating learning experiences that are tailored to your organization‚Äôs specific needs, the attacks you receive, and your colleagues‚Äô skill level.

features.list.ui.description.message: ZH-HANS-Intuitive dashboard for easy navigation and management of quizzes and user data.

features.list.roles.description.message: ZH-HANS-Different access levels for admins, managers, and employees.

features.list.realLife.description.message: ZH-HANS-Ability to input details from actual phishing attacks the company has experienced.

features.list.email.description.message: ZH-HANS-Create quizzes that mimic phishing emails on Gmail and Outlook, including headers, body, images and attachments.

features.list.sms.description.message: ZH-HANS-Design quizzes that simulate SMS phishing attempts with realistic text messages.

features.list.messaging.description.message: ZH-HANS-Include quizzes that replicate phishing through WhatsApp, Messenger, etc.

features.list.mobile.description.message: ZH-HANS-Users can take Shira quizzes on mobile devices to simulate real-life scenarios.

features.list.compliance.description.message: ZH-HANS-Ensure that your team actually completes your quizzes and monitor success rates.

features.list.analytics.description.message: ZH-HANS-Track user progress and identify areas for improvement.

features.list.explanations.description.message: ZH-HANS-Embed your own explanations on why an email or message looks like phishing.

features.list.gamification.description.message: ZH-HANS-An entertaining learning experience promotes better knowledge retention.

features.list.multilingual.description.message: ZH-HANS-Shira is fully available in English, Spanish, French, Mandarin, Arabic and Russian.

features.list.library.description.message: ZH-HANS-Pull from Shira's question library to start your trainings from templates created by digital security trainers.

features.needMore.subtitle.message: ZH-HANS-Get in touch. We‚Äôll make it happen.

homepage.meta.description.message: ZH-HANS-Shira builds your team's ability to identify and defeat phishing attacks.

homepage.meta.longDescription.message: ZH-HANS-Shira helps individuals and organizations learn to spot and defeat phishing attacks through interactive, privacy-friendly quizzes, customizable for real-world apps like Gmail, SMS, and WhatsApp, context and language.

homepage.hero.subtitle.message: ZH-HANS-Shira builds your team's ability to identify and defeat phishing attacks

homepage.learners.description.message: ZH-HANS-Get started right away with one of our free, ready-made quizzes. Customize the quiz to learn to identify phishing in the apps you use in real life ‚Äî Gmail, SMS, WhatsApp, etc ‚Äî with examples tailored to your language and field of work.

homepage.educators.description.message: ZH-HANS-Each organization has its own needs and faces its own threats. Build phishing quizzes tailored to your organization‚Äôs needs and monitor your team‚Äôs success rates ‚Äî all without technical skills.

homepage.context.description.message: ZH-HANS-For years, phishing has been one of the most common types of attacks facing individuals and organizations. While it has been traditionally limited to emails, phishing now also happens via SMS, messaging apps, and social media. Building users‚Äô skills to identify and defeat phishing attacks is more needed than ever before.

homepage.context.imageAlt.message: ZH-HANS-decorative image of a magnifier glass

homepage.why.intro.message: ZH-HANS-Whether you‚Äôre just taking our ready-made, free quizzes, or you‚Äôre taking the time to build your own custom quizzes, Shira is:

homepage.why.easy.description.message: ZH-HANS-Created for communities most at risk of phishing attacks, even with limited tech literacy.

homepage.why.customizable.description.message: ZH-HANS-Realistic phishing messages to simulate real scenarios users face daily.

homepage.why.privacy.description.message: ZH-HANS-We do not collect or share any user data.

phishingQuizzes.meta.longDescription.message: ZH-HANS-Learn why phishing quizzes are more effective than simulations.

phishingQuizzes.education.paragraph1.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing simulations have become a standard component of anti-phishing training programs. These simulations involve sending employees emails that mimic the tactics used by cybercriminals to trick individuals into revealing sensitive information or clicking on malicious links. Employees are assessed based on their responses to these simulated emails, particularly whether they clicked on a link or provided any sensitive information.

phishingQuizzes.education.paragraph2.message: ZH-HANS-However, this approach has several drawbacks and is not as effective as providing comprehensive anti-phishing education.

phishingQuizzes.education.wsjAltDesktop.message: ZH-HANS-News article from the wall street journal Phishing Tests, the Bane of Work Life, Are Getting Meaner - Researchers say the ruses, aimed at teaching gullible employees about the dangers lurking online, doesn‚Äôt even work

phishingQuizzes.education.wsjAltMobile.message: ZH-HANS-News article from the wall street journal Phishing Tests, the Bane of Work Life, Are Getting Meaner - Researchers say the ruses, aimed at teaching gullible employees about the dangers lurking online, doesn‚Äôt even work

phishingQuizzes.problem.intro.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing simulations, while widely used, come with several issues that organizations should consider:

phishingQuizzes.problem.anxiety.text.message: ZH-HANS-Users may become anxious or mistrustful of emails, even legitimate ones, which can lead to decreased productivity and increased stress.

phishingQuizzes.problem.emailFocus.text.message: ZH-HANS-Many phishing simulations primarily target email threats, overlooking other channels like SMS, messaging apps, or social media.

phishingQuizzes.problem.falseSecurity.te.message: ZH-HANS-If employees successfully identify simulated phishing attempts, they may develop a false sense of security.

phishingQuizzes.problem.clickRates.text.message: ZH-HANS-Focusing solely on whether employees clicked on a link can overlook other important aspects of phishing awareness.

phishingQuizzes.problem.desensitize.text.message: ZH-HANS-Repeatedly sending fake phishing emails can desensitize users to the threat.

phishingQuizzes.problem.punishment.title.message: ZH-HANS-Focus on punishment rather than prevention:

phishingQuizzes.problem.punishment.text.message: ZH-HANS-Simulated phishing emails can create a culture of fear, where users are more focused on avoiding punishment than on learning.

phishingQuizzes.research.text.message: ZH-HANS-Research finds that phishing simulation campaigns do not effectively train people in identifying phishing attacks.

phishingQuizzes.research.conclusion.message: ZH-HANS-actually showed a counterproductive effect of phishing simulations.

phishingQuizzes.quizzes.title.message: ZH-HANS-A more effective approach: phishing quizzes

phishingQuizzes.quizzes.description.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing quizzes provide a controlled learning environment that is more effective for skill-building than traditional phishing simulations.

phishingQuizzes.benefits.controlled.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing quizzes create a safe and low-stakes space for employees to practice their skills.

phishingQuizzes.benefits.interactive.tex.message: ZH-HANS-These quizzes encourage active participation and provide immediate feedback.

phishingQuizzes.benefits.coverage.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing quizzes can incorporate SMS, social media, and voice phishing scenarios.

phishingQuizzes.benefits.confidence.text.message: ZH-HANS-Employees learn from mistakes in a supportive environment.

phishingQuizzes.benefits.tailored.text.message: ZH-HANS-Quizzes can be customized to focus on specific skills and knowledge gaps.

phishing.layout.description.message: ZH-HANS-Learn what phishing is, how it works, and why it‚Äôs effective. Discover the most common phishing attacks, what attackers seek, and the serious consequences for individuals and organizations.

phishing.meta.description.message: ZH-HANS-Learn what phishing is, how it works, and why it‚Äôs effective. Discover the most common phishing attacks, what attackers seek, and the serious consequences for individuals and organizations.

phishing.intro.definition.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing is a malicious attempt to obtain sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, and credit card details by disguising as a trustworthy entity in electronic communications. Phishing can also tempt you to download and install malware.

phishing.intro.protection.message: ZH-HANS-Understanding phishing is the first step in protecting yourself and your organization.

phishing.common.rank.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing is consistently ranked as the most common attack experienced by individuals and organizations.

phishing.common.channels.message: ZH-HANS-While phishing has been traditionally associated with email scams, today it takes place across a wide variety of mediums: email, but also SMS, messaging apps, social media platforms, and phone calls.

phishing.attackers.title.message: ZH-HANS-What do attackers try to obtain?

phishing.attackers.passwords.text.message: ZH-HANS-Attackers seek to steal passwords and login credentials to access victims' online accounts. With this information, they can commit fraud, steal data, or blackmail victims by threatening to expose sensitive information.

phishing.attackers.money.text.message: ZH-HANS-Financial gain is a key motive for phishing. Attackers impersonate legitimate organizations to trick victims into providing credit card details or making payments, often through fake invoices or donation requests.

phishing.attackers.confidential.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing targets confidential information like Social Security numbers and business data. This information can be used for identity theft, sold on the dark web, or exploited for corporate espionage.

phishing.attackers.malware.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishers may trick victims into downloading malware through malicious links or attachments. Once installed, malware can steal personal information, monitor activity, or take control of devices, leading to serious data breaches.

phishing.why.polite.text.message: ZH-HANS-People often feel compelled to respond to messages from authority figures or trusted sources. Phishers exploit this by using polite language, making recipients more likely to comply with requests for sensitive information without questioning the message's legitimacy.

phishing.why.helpful.text.message: ZH-HANS-Many of us naturally want to assist others. Phishers create scenarios that prompt recipients to help, such as claiming a colleague or relative is in trouble. This manipulation can lead individuals to provide personal information, believing they are being supportive.

phishing.why.embarrassed.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishers instill fear by suggesting the recipient has made a mistake, like missing a payment. This fear can push individuals to act quickly, often without verifying the message's source, leading to compromised security.

phishing.why.urgent.text.message: ZH-HANS-Urgency is a strong motivator. Phishers craft messages that create a false sense of urgency, claiming accounts will be suspended or payments are overdue. This panic can cloud judgment, causing individuals to overlook warning signs and act impulsively.

phishing.consequences.title.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing attacks can lead to severe consequences

phishing.consequences.identity.text.message: ZH-HANS-Cybercriminals can use your personal information to impersonate you.

phishing.consequences.financial.text.message: ZH-HANS-Unauthorized transactions can drain your accounts.

phishing.consequences.data.text.message: ZH-HANS-Sensitive company information can be exposed, leading to reputational damage.

phishing.consequences.operational.text.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing can result in downtime and loss of productivity.

phishing.how.intro.message: ZH-HANS-Phishing attacks often involve the following steps:

phishing.how.deceptive.text.message: ZH-HANS-Attackers send messages that appear to come from legitimate sources, such as banks, online services, or even colleagues.

phishing.how.urgent.text.message: ZH-HANS-The message usually contains a sense of urgency, prompting the recipient to act quickly‚Äîsuch as clicking a link or providing personal information.

phishing.how.fake.text.message: ZH-HANS-If the victim clicks on a link, they are often directed to a fraudulent website that looks similar to the legitimate one. Here, they may be asked to enter sensitive information such as their password or banking information.

phishing.how.data.text.message: ZH-HANS-Once the victim provides their information, attackers can use it for identity theft, financial fraud, or other malicious purposes.

pricing.layout.description.message: ZH-HANS-Explore Shira‚Äôs simple and transparent pricing plans for educators, security professionals, and organizations. Choose between Free, Pro, or Enterprise options with customizable phishing quizzes and privacy-friendly management tools.
